title.value: Pre-Training Protein Encoder via Siamese Sequence-Structure Diffusion Trajectory Prediction
title.justification: This is the title of the paper.
title.quote: Pre-Training Protein Encoder via Siamese Sequence-Structure Diffusion Trajectory Prediction

extractions.description: This paper introduces DiffPreT, a novel pre-training approach that utilizes sequence-structure joint diffusion modeling to pre-train a protein encoder. It also enhances DiffPreT with Siamese Diffusion Trajectory Prediction (SiamDiff), which captures the correlation between different conformers of a protein through mutual information maximization.

type.justification: The paper contains experimental results to validate the proposed models and methods on various tasks, hence it is an empirical study.
type.quote: Experimental results show that the performance of DiffPreT is consistently competitive on all tasks, and SiamDiff achieves new state-of-the-art performance, considering the mean ranks on all tasks.

name.justification: The paper's main focus is on improving protein structure understanding and function prediction, which falls under the computational biology domain.
name.quote: Self-supervised pre-training methods on proteins have recently gained attention, with most approaches focusing on either protein sequences or structures.

name.justification: The paper discusses methods for predicting and understanding protein structures.
name.quote: Machine learning-based methods have made remarkable strides in predicting protein structures.

name.justification: One of the objectives of the paper is to predict the functions of proteins using the pre-trained models.
name.quote: Tasks encompass protein function annotation, protein-protein interaction prediction, mutational effect prediction, residue structural contributions, and protein structure ranking.

name.justification: The paper proposes a self-supervised learning method for pre-training protein encoders using multi-modal protein data.
name.quote: These pre-training approaches are based on the rationale that modeling the input distribution of proteins provides favorable initialization of model parameters.

name.justification: The primary model introduced and discussed in the paper.
name.quote: we propose the DiffPreT approach to pre-train a protein encoder by sequence-structure joint diffusion modeling.

is_contributed.justification: DiffPreT is introduced as a novel approach in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: we propose the DiffPreT approach to pre-train a protein encoder by sequence-structure joint diffusion modeling.

is_executed.justification: The DiffPreT model is executed as part of the experimental validation in the paper.
is_executed.quote: Experimental results show that the performance of DiffPreT is consistently competitive on all tasks, and SiamDiff achieves new state-of-the-art performance, considering the mean ranks on all tasks.

is_compared.justification: The paper compares DiffPreT against several baseline methods.
is_compared.quote: Experimental results show that the performance of DiffPreT is consistently competitive on all tasks, and SiamDiff achieves new state-of-the-art performance, considering the mean ranks on all tasks.

referenced_paper_title.justification: DiffPreT is the main contribution of this paper.

name.justification: An enhancement of DiffPreT introduced in the paper.
name.quote: We enhance DiffPreT by a method called Siamese Diffusion Trajectory Prediction (SiamDiff) to capture the correlation between different conformers of a protein.

is_contributed.justification: SiamDiff is introduced as a novel method and enhancement of DiffPreT in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: We enhance DiffPreT by a method called Siamese Diffusion Trajectory Prediction (SiamDiff) to capture the correlation between different conformers of a protein.

is_executed.justification: The SiamDiff model is executed as part of the experimental validation in the paper.
is_executed.quote: Experimental results show that SiamDiff achieves new state-of-the-art performance, considering the mean ranks on all tasks.

is_compared.justification: SiamDiff is compared against other baseline methods as well as DiffPreT alone.
is_compared.quote: Experimental results show that SiamDiff achieves new state-of-the-art performance, considering the mean ranks on all tasks.

referenced_paper_title.justification: SiamDiff is the main contribution of this paper.

name.justification: The AlphaFold Database v1 is utilized for pre-training the models in the paper.
name.quote: Following Zhang et al. [86], we pre-train our models with the AlphaFold protein structure database v1 [43, 69], including 365K proteome-wide predicted structures.

referenced_paper_title.value: Highly accurate protein structure prediction with AlphaFold
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is based on structures predicted by AlphaFold as explained in this referenced paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Highly accurate protein structure prediction with AlphaFold

name.justification: PyTorch is used as part of the implementation for the experimental validation in the paper.
name.quote: All methods are developed based on PyTorch and TorchDrug.

referenced_paper_title.value: PyTorch: An Imperative Style, High-Performance Deep Learning Library
referenced_paper_title.justification: This refers to the main paper describing PyTorch.
referenced_paper_title.quote: PyTorch: An Imperative Style, High-Performance Deep Learning Library

name.justification: TorchDrug is used as part of the implementation for the experimental validation in the paper.
name.quote: All methods are developed based on PyTorch and TorchDrug.

referenced_paper_title.value: TorchDrug: A Powerful and Flexible Machine Learning Platform for Drug Discovery
referenced_paper_title.justification: This refers to the main paper describing TorchDrug.
referenced_paper_title.quote: TorchDrug: A Powerful and Flexible Machine Learning Platform for Drug Discovery
